Text: That guy's story \n came true!
Huh, what do you mean?
N-No, we-
I'll take you out and \n get everyone back!
I better get \n back to him.
There might still be a \n chance to warn everyone \n about the menace.
HYAAAAAH!
You'll never take me!
The Scarab People will \n know you're not one of \n them.
Deliver this and the \n photo evidence to my \n editor.
And for goodness sake, \n don't run, they'll spot \n you.
You can't pull \n one over on me!
Thank you, everyone, for \n your help!
The poor girl really \n fell deep...
Wha-!?
Maybe we went \n a little too far...
I-I saw them!
Behind you!
I'm so glad I found you!
Ah!
I'll stay here and round \n up any other survivors.

It was kind of a 
 mean trick, but it's 
 cool to be the model 
 for another story.
Calm down, we have to \n keep a level head and \n figure this out.
The whole town was \n in on it with me.
Wait! Don't use your \n powers.
And you fell for it.
Right! They can't ignore \n this proof.
So they really are \n Scarab People...
Well, those Scarabs were \n real, but the hoax was a \n real hoax.
Thanks to you, I've got \n the perfect ending to my \n new book.
And if you need to get \n out of a jam, point to \n the sky like they do.
I guess I'm just glad \n there is no such thing \n as Scarab People...
They were Scarab People, \n just like you said.
Who are you!?
Are you okay?
A hoax?
Are you ready to attend \n the awards ceremony now?
This synopsis has all of \n my research notes.

I'm sorry to keep you 
 waiting, my editor will 
 see you get paid well 
 for your trouble.
The Scarab People \n Menace - truly the \n hoax of the century!
We certainly don't have \n the advertising budget \n to hire real ones.
I need your help, if \n we're to save humanity!
Mmphmphwahaha! \n I'm sorry, I couldn't \n hold it in anymore.
Have to admit, I was \n surprised to see \n those Scarabs.
That whole story about \n the Scarab People, it's \n true!
Y-You liar.
Thank you again, miracle \n girl! You're like my own \n real-life muse.
And I did! Oh, if \n only you could've \n seen your face.
N-No, anywhere but \n there! I'll write it \n from home, I promise!
You're free to go home.

You can get started on 
 the new novel once it's 
 over in your "special 
 room."
I'm so glad you're back \n to normal.
I'm sorry to play such a \n mean trick on you.

I was so upset you saw 
 through my disguises, 
 that I had to find a way 
 to get you back.

I hope this time 
 it's exciting enough 
 to keep me awake 
 when I read it.
This is exactly what the \n people want to read!

But the author wouldn't 
 give us an exclusive 
 contract unless we 
 helped him.
I hope we'll meet \n again... as ourselves.
Wait, if the hoax was a \n hoax, does that mean \n it's not a hoax?
A Scarab! And it isn't \n attacking anyone.

Just make sure you time 
 it right and do what 
 they do, or you'll stand 
 out.
I knew it, you're one of \n them too! You're all \n Scarab People!
I'm saying that other \n than the real Scarabs, \n everything was an act!
I'll do what I can... \n *Gulp*

There you are, Scarabs! 
 You're the ones turning 
 everyone into your 
 slaves!

A young girl risks her 
 life to defeat the 
 Scarabs and save the 
 town!

We spent a small fortune 
 to pull this off. We 
 even built a realistic 
 Scarab suit.

If you move slow and 
 blend in, you can move 
 among the Scarab People 
 and reach my editor.
Yep, you got me.
W-Wonderful! \n You pulled it off!
Boy, it was getting \n hot in there.
You're still trying to \n fool me. You're one of \n them now!
Are you two okay?
One of who-... \n Uh-oh...
I don't think he's this way.
Hm? Isn't that the book \n editor I met earlier?
Hey! How's it going?
Oh thank goodness, \n I've been looking \n all over for you!
Uh-oh... I'm guessing \n it's about our favourite \n author?
Yeah, he ran off again!
This time he ran off \n right before the awards \n ceremony.
An award? Did he win one \n for the book you \n published?
Yes! But he fled, saying \n he had research to do \n for a new novel.
Please, you have to \n bring him back before \n the ceremony starts.
I'll be glad to help. \n After all, I was the \n model for his story.
I'd be eternally \n grateful. Here's the \n latest plot synopsis.
Prologue: One morning a \n man noticed something \n disturbing in his city.
The place was the same, \n but something was off \n about the people.
They were being \n controlled by Scarabs!
Chapter 1: The man hid \n himself in a back alley, \n out of sight.
There he observed the \n Scarab People.

And discovered they 
 shared a habit: they 
 would raise an arm and 
 point to the sky.

Chapter 2: The man 
 followed their habit to 
 blend in and make his 
 escape.
Chapter 3: He tried \n fleeing the city on a \n boat in the market.
But the Scarab People \n were already there.
Whoa! I finished it. But \n there's more, right?

Of course, but the 
 author hasn't been 
 able to settle on an 
 ending yet.

This is the model for 
 the main character. 
 He's bound to be 
 disguised as him.
Got it! I found him \n before, I'll find him \n again.

I hope so... I've got to 
 admit I'm worried. He's 
 been acting strange 
 lately.
I'm not sure "lately" \n quite fits.
Well, you have a point \n there. I'll go over and \n search the market.
Head Down the Stairs \n to the Lower Level
Find the Author \n Using the Picture
According to the plot, he should be around here somewhere.
Townsperson: \n Uh, you must have the wrong person.
Townsperson: \n You need something?
Townsperson: \n Sounds a little like me, but think you have the wrong guy.
Townsperson: \n Sorry, not sure who you're talking about.
Oops, my mistake.
Hmm, my bad.
He should be here somewhere...
Where is that guy?
Close, but not quite the same person.
Not even close.
I should reread the plot for hints.
The man hid in a back alley to observe the Scarab People...
That must mean he's trying to stay out of sight.
I need to head down to the lower levels.

According to the 
 synopsis, the author 
 should be hiding in a 
 back street somewhere.
A minor street... Maybe \n he's on one of the \n streets down below?
Hmm, he could be around \n here somewhere.
Let me check the first \n chapter again...

The man hid himself in 
 a back street, out of 
 sight. There he observed 
 the Scarab People.

And discovered they 
 shared a habit: they 
 would raise an arm and 
 point to the sky.
Hmm...

Guess I should be on the 
 lookout for someone 
 observing others from a 
 back street.
Hey, that guy seems to \n be watching people...
Found you!

Oh, it's the miracle 
 girl! You haven't 
 been... taken... have 
 you?

Taken? What are you 
 talking about? We have 
 to get you to the awards 
 ceremony.
This is no time for \n that! I've discovered a \n horrible truth.
The people in this city \n are transforming into \n Scarab People.
Oh, that's right. Your \n novel's setting was all \n about that.
Please, you have to \n believe me. Our future \n depends on it.
Maybe his editor \n is right. He is \n acting strange.
Fine, you don't have to \n believe me, but please, \n I have a request.
Can you grab a picture \n of the Scarab People \n for me?
There are some \n wandering around near \n the terrace down below.

Okay... But if I take a 
 picture for you, you'll 
 come back to the 
 awards ceremony?
Make sure you stay out \n of sight when you grab \n the picture.
If they know you're not \n one of them, they'll \n attack.
Hmm? They're acting a \n little suspicious.
I think the author wrote \n about this, let's see...
They shared a habit: \n they would raise an arm \n and point to the sky.

This is just like in 
 that author's plot! Are 
 they really Scarab 
 People?
B-But it's just a novel. \n It has to be fiction... \n Doesn't it?

Just to be on the safe 
 side, I better be 
 careful taking their 
 picture.

I got the picture, but 
 those two haven't budged 
 since I first saw 
 them...
Is that author telling \n the truth about the \n Scarab People?
Hm!?
I have to find the Scarab People.
Guess I'll play along for now.
Head to the Photo Spot and Take \n a Picture of the Scarab People
Author: \n Hurry up and take a picture of the Scarab People!
Capture the \n Scarab People on Film
I need to take a picture of those people.
Author: \n Did you get the picture?
Got it! This picture should work.
Hmm, I think I'm a little too far away.
I need to get both of them in the shot.
Scarab Person: \n You... not... one of us.
Return to the Author
I need to get back to the author!
Scarab Person: \n You... not... Scarab...
AAGH!
I need to get back to the editor.
Pretend to be a Scarab Person \n to Return to the Editor
AAGH!
I... Scarab... girl...
Scarab Person: \n You... not... like us...
Phew, close one.
Oh wow, that was too close.
Phew, fooled 'em.
It's up to me to save the world!
I... Scarab... girl... That should work.
I hope the author and his editor are alright.
I need to time pretending to be them just right.
Maybe it'd be easier to stay out of sight.
Oh no...
Not the author too...
Am I the only one left!?
Author: \n Join... us...
Never!
Defeat the Scarabs and Save \n Everyone from their Horrible Fate
I can't let those Scarabs go.
That should do the trick!
I should get back to what I was doing.
